result.execSummary:
The defendant John P. Krug was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall participate in the Taylor County Drug Court which includes paying the $170.00 participant fee through Human Services.  Defendant shall comply with all treatment recommendations.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victims due within 30 days of sentencing to be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The unpaid costs are reduced to a civil judgment.

The jail sentence shall begin immediately.  The jail sentence shall be with good time.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Taylor County Cases 17CF44 and 16CF100

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

01:29 PM Defendant John P. Krug in court with attorney Jon Padgham.  Defendant John P. Krug in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court indicated to Attorney Padgham that she wrote a letter to him regarding her presiding over the case. Attorney Padgham has received the revocation packet and defendant is contesting some of the allegations that are in the packet.  Victim rights complied with.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty regarding sentencing.  Statement by Attorney Padgham regarding sentencing.  No statement by defendant. Defendant John P. Krug in court with attorney Patrick McClain.   Defendant John P. Krug in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  . Plea agreement put into the record. records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 20, 2017 at 08:30 am.
for leave to withdraw

Defendant John P. Krug in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Snyder informs the Court that he is motioning for withdrawal as the DE informed him this morning that he would like to have the attorney assigned on his most recent case to be appointed on this case as well. Atty. Snyder states that the DE also informed him that he no longer wants to move forward with the agreement he previously approved. Court grants Atty. Snyder's motion to withdraw and informs the DE he is to contact the Public Defenders office and apply for appointment in this case. Atty. Snyder to prepare order. Court warns DE that no more withdrawals or adjournments will be allowed and that if he does not wish to continue with his new attorney, he forfeits his right to a lawyer and will be representing himself at that point. DE states he understands. ap
